securityRules.description: All sensitive credentials (API keys, database passwords, etc.) must be stored securely using AWS Secrets Manager.
securityRules.rationale: Avoids hardcoding secrets in code or configuration files.

securityRules.description: Protect sensitive API endpoints using JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for authentication and authorization.
securityRules.rationale: Ensures only authenticated and authorized users can access specific resources.

securityRules.description: All SQL queries generated by the NLQ system (GPT-4o) must undergo rigorous cleaning and validation before execution.
securityRules.rationale: Prevents SQL injection vulnerabilities and unintended data modification/deletion.

securityRules.description: The NLQ validation process must explicitly ensure that only SELECT statements are permitted.
securityRules.rationale: Provides a critical layer of defense against malicious or accidental data manipulation via the NLQ interface.

securityRules.description: Log all NLQ-generated queries (both original and cleaned/validated versions) for auditing and security analysis.
All communication between the frontend and backend, and any external services, must use HTTPS.
securityRules.rationale: Encrypts data in transit, preventing eavesdropping.

securityRules.description: Regularly scan project dependencies for known vulnerabilities using appropriate security tools.
securityRules.rationale: Mitigates risks associated with third-party libraries.
